abstract.para: It is sometimes useful to place a group of resources on the same node (defining a colocation constraint), but without having hard dependencies between the resources. For example, you want two resources to be placed on the same node, but you do not want the cluster to restart the other one if one of them fails.

topic.para: This can be achieved on the &crmshell; by using the weak-bond command. The weak-bond command creates a dummy resource and a colocation constraint with the given resources automatically. You can perform this procedure on any node in the cluster:

step.para: Log in either as the &rootuser; user or as a user with sudo privileges.

step.screen: &prompt.user;sudo crm configure assist weak-bond RESOURCE1 RESOURCE2 Create weak bond / independent colocation The following elements will be created: * Colocation constraint, ID: place-constraint-1 * Dummy resource, ID: place-dummy-1 Create resources (y/n)?

step.para: Enter y to create the dummy resource and colocation constraint.
